label: 透彫
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 56th  . Nara National Museum . 2004
説明文: Openwork designs result when the material-usually metal, wood, or leather-is pierced through or cut out to create decorative negative space. In metalwork, openwork is made by piercing small holes along the design outlines, cutting away the excess with a chisel, and filing the edges.
